thread.title: Saved By The Bell star Elizabeth Berkley spotted shopping in Hollywood 28 years after shooting to fame as Jesse Spano

author: jkavanagh
title: Saved By The Bell star Elizabeth Berkley spotted shopping in Hollywood 28 years after shooting to fame as Jesse Spano
text:
TV Magazine REMEMBER HER? Saved By The Bell star Elizabeth Berkley spotted shopping in Hollywood 28 years after shooting to fame as Jesse Spano 
The 80s child star looks like she hasn't aged a day as she enjoys some retail therapy BY JOANNE KAVANAGH Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SAVED By The Bell star Elizabeth Berkley looks like she hasn’t aged a day, even though it’s been nearly 30 years since she shot to fame. 
The blonde beauty became a child star in 1989 when she joined the cast of the High School comedy playing Jesse Spano. Alamy Elizabeth Berkley shot to fame in 1989 in Saved By The Bell playing Jesse Spano Fame Flynet The actress, who is now 44, was spotted out shopping in Hollywood 
But she was spotted out shopping today in Hollywood and she looked like time had stood still. 
The 44-year-old was seen browsing shops in Melrose Avenue wearing a very low cut floral frock. Fame Flynet She hardly looked like she had aged a day Fame Flynet She was seen doing some retail therapy in Melrose Fame Flynet The fresh faced actress showed off her famous pins 
Her dress also revealed her famous long legs and she wore her trademark long locks loose. 
Elizabeth shot to fame when she was 17 playing the feisty Jesse until 1993. Classic theme tune for 90s High School tv series Saved by the Bell RELATED STORIES model in training Victoria's Secret Angel Martha Hunt poses up a storm in outdoor gym for 1980s inspired photoshoot 'MY GUARDIAN ANGEL' Charlotte Dawson pays tribute to late dad Les on anniversary of his birthday with throwback pic JAMIE'S BIG NIGHT CBB's Jamie O'Hara flashes beaming smile as he dances and sings with mystery brunette at Drake concert C-BOMB TOM Nicola McLean’s husband Tom Williams brands Kim Woodburn and Jedward ‘c***s’ MJ'S POKER FACE Lady Gaga gives a sneak peek of her Super Bowl performance and reveals she's been inspired by Jacko Alamy Elizabeth was put in the spotlight when she joined the cast of Saved By The Bell Alamy 8 She starred alongside Mario Lopez, who played her on screen boyfriend AC Slater 
After leaving Saved By The Bell to try to break into film, she won the role of Nomi Malone in the controversial 1995 film Showgirls. 
The saucy film was widely panned by critics, but over the years has gone on to be a cult classic. United Artists After leaving Saved By The Bell she starred in the raunchy film Showgirls 
Since then, Elizabeth has starred in numerous TV shows and films. Elizabeth Berkley in Showgirls
